attributes.action: Remove the privilege of subsidised food and drink given to MPs and Peers.
attributes.additional_details:
MPs/Peers are paid by salary/allowance + expenses.
- MPs were awarded a 2.7% pay rise
- Peers increased their daily allowance by 3.1%
- Inflation was 1.3%
- In 2017 taxpayers paid over £4m subsiding Parliament's food & drink.
Lord True's Committee has said that benefits eg free TV licences for over 75s should be abolished, subsidies ie. free bus passes, winter fuel payments & the pensions triple lock should be cut. 
A 2.7-3.1% increase surely takes MPs/Peers away from needing the subsidy.
attributes.background:
Equalise society by removing the privilege of subsidised food and drink given to MPs and Peers.
Whilst there seems to be a need for a certain demographic to give up some rewards, Parliament is behaving completely contrary to this and should be leading and setting an example to us all.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

Food in Parliament is not subsidised in the commercial sense of the word. You can read more here: https://www.parliament.uk/site-information/foi/transparency-publications/hoc-transparency-publications/catering-services/transparency-reporting-catering-services/

We're not whether you want MPs and Peers no longer to be able to access low-cost food, or for commercial prices to be paid by all those working in and visiting Parliament. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
